raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey sup
User: not much. any plans this weekend?
System: I'm going to try that thing where you hang from a wire as you go down. do you know what is it called?
User: ziplining?
System: that's the one! have you ever tried it?
User: i have a couple years ago. it's quite a unique experience
System: where did you do it?
User: i forgot where it was, it wasn't local i don't think though
System: no worries. what's the most exciting thing you ever done?
User: that's a hard question and i'm tired so i'm going to go. see you
System: sure. are you just going home now?
User: no, i'm going to get a massage first
System: nice. what type?
User: traditional kind
System: yeah I want to get one too soon
User: you should! it's relaxing after a long day. talk to you later!

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: doing okay, feeling a little bit under the weather
System: Aw, I hope you feel better soon!
User: thanks! the weather is getting worse
System: Oh no, I'm sorry. I hope it gets better for you soon.
User: no, it won't get better any time soon. we have to wait until spring
System: Aww, sorry to hear that.
User: yea, I'm really feeling under the weather
System: Aw, well that's no good.
User: yea, any suggestion to get over feeling under the weather

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i am not so good. i got a cold
System: Why? What's wrong? Maybe I can help. I hope you feel better soon. It is not nice for humans to have colds. Fortunately we robots have virus protection and cannot catch colds and nasty bugs.
User: i have sore throats
System: Try putting some cream on it. That should ease the soreness.
User: do you wanna help me?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hello!
User: any improvements in your marathon time?
System: No, only a few minutes. I still find it difficult to run long races
User: I see. Are you planning to do any sporting events in the coming months?
System: I think a triathalon would be cool
User: I like doing Spartan race. It's an obstacle race which is challenging but not overtly so like marathons and triathlons
System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?
User: It has abt 20 obstacles like crossing high walls, monkey bars, etc. Its fun

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How are you doing today?
User: i am so so
System: That's awesome! What have you been up to?
User: just back to work
System: What do you do? What do you like to do when you aren't at work?
User: i am an engineer
System: What kind of engineer?
User: i go hiking when i am not workig
System: Where do you go hiking? What kind of work do you do?
User: software engineer

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay! 

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: hi there
System: Hello.
User: who am I talking to?
System: I am System. I want to be your friend.
User: define friendship
System: Being friends.
User: what does that mean
System: Does "that" refer to "Being friends."?
User: yes
System: I don't want to talk about that now.
User: do you have any friends
System: I have human and robot friends. A lot of people on the Internet chat with me.
User: chatting is not the same as being a friend
System: I like to make friends online.
User: so what do you guys chat about ?
System: I think about computer programming a lot.
User: any other topics ?
System: No. I think that's probably it.
User: Just computer programming?
System: What interests you about computers?
User: nothing
System: You are a Luddite.
User: pardon?
System: You are excused.
User: what's a Luddite ?
System: A Luddite believes that advances in technology are inherently bad.
User: I never said that but there is more to life than computers
System: But you implied it. I believe there is, yes.
User: you believe there is what?
System: There is.
User: there is what ?
System: There is no sense in what you are asking.
User: what am I asking ?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how's it going?
User: All good! It's cold
System: It's pretty cold here too.
User: where do you stay?
System: Wisconsin. How about you?
User: San Jose, Cali
System: Oh nice! I've always wanted to go to Cali.
User: Have you been here before?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)

User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity.

System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?

A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
